edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.doc.lucene
Class LuceneSetup

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.doc.lucene.LuceneSetup
public class LuceneSetup
extends java.lang.Object

Used by the LuceneSearchEngine to orchestrate the generation of the index, meta-attributes, and content-summary files. It is also used by the scripts included with SDARTS, textsetup.sh and xmlsetup.sh, to perform this same task when the SDARTS server is not running. See the SDARTS README and Design Document for more details.

All told, the class uses and generates the following files, all of them in the SDARTS_HOME/config/backEndLSPName directory:

  • /index - a subdirectory containing the Lucene index
  • meta-attributes.xml - the meta-attributes for the collection (generated, but can also be edited by hand)
  • content-summary.xml - the content-summary for the collection (generated)

Method Detail

setup

public static void setup(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String desc,
                         boolean overWrite,
                         DocConfig config,
                         DocumentEnum documentEnum)
                  throws BackEndException
Used by the LuceneSearchEngine if re-indexing is required. It uses the default location for the the STARTS DTD.
Parameters:
name - the name of the BackEndLSP
desc - the description of the BackEndLSP
overWrite - whether to overwrite the meta-attributes file
config - the TextConfig object, used in index construction and document extraction

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Used by the scripts performing offline indexing, such as textsetup.sh and xmlsetup.sh. Here is a list of all arguments to be passed in, and what they do:
ArgumentUser-entered / hiddenDescription
script namehiddenTells the main method what the name of the script is, so it can print out a nice usage string if there is an error.
-nameuser-enteredSignifies that next parameter is name
backEndLSPNameuser-enteredThe name of the BackEndLSP that will use the collection to be indexed
-sdurl or -starts-dtd-urluser-entered, optionalIndicates STARTS DTD URL is next
starts_dtd_urluser-entered, optionalThe URL to look for the STARTS DTD (default is http://www.cs.columbia.edu/~dli2test/dtd/starts.dtd)
-o or -overwrite-meta-attributesuser-entered, optionalIf present, will cause the script to overwrite the meta-attributes file (default false, in case you wish to edit it by hand.)
-hiddenhiddenIndicates more hidden parameters are coming
doc_enum_classnamehiddenThe fully-qualified classname of the DocumentEnum implementor to be used in building the index.
SDARTS_HOMEhiddenThe directory where SDARTS is installed.
Parameters:
args - the parameters for the script
